Detailed Description

Wrapper for platform-dependend threads implementation.

Wrapper for platform-dependend threads identification.

Member Function Documentation

ThreadHandle const* sample_tools::AThread::getHandle ( ) const

Returns a handle of the thread.

Returns
Returned object is owned by AThread. Returned value MUST not be removed.
PriorityLevel sample_tools::AThread::getPriority ( ) const

Get thread priority.

bool sample_tools::AThread::isRunning ( ) const

Returns the thread status.

Returns
If thread is running, return true. If thread is stopped, return false.
bool sample_tools::AThread::isStopRequested ( ) const

Returns terminate flag state.

Returns
If terminate flag is set, return true. If terminate flag is not set, return false.
bool sample_tools::AThread::join ( unsigned long  waitMilliseconds = INFINITE)

Waits for the thread to terminate.

Parameters
waitMilliseconds- the time-out interval, in milliseconds. The function returns if the interval elapses, even if the tread state is running. If waitMilliseconds is zero, the function tests the thread's state and returns immediately. If waitMilliseconds is INFINITE, the function's time-out interval never elapses.
Returns
If the function succeeds (the thread is terminated), the return value is true. If the function fails or the interval elapses, the return value is false.
void sample_tools::AThread::requestStop ( )

Sets a terminate flag.

bool sample_tools::AThread::setPriority ( PriorityLevel  ePrior)

Set thread priority.

bool sample_tools::AThread::start ( )

Creates a new thread.

Returns
If the function succeeds or thread is already created by previous call, the returned value is true. If the function fails, the returned value is false.
